Methods

We turn our attention now to the syntax used to define methods within a class. Although the syntax for methods varies widely from language to language, all methods will have the following features.

  • A name. This is the text used to select the method.
  • A signature. This is a description that combines the return type and the argument type. In languages that permit this, multiple methods with the same name can be distinguised by different signatures.
  • A body. This is the code that will be executed when the method is selected in response to a message.
Now let us see how these parts are expressed in different langauges.
